faqs.question: Who can apply for Online Banking?
faqs.answer: Customers holding a Savings Account, Current Account, Deposit Account, Loan Account, or Credit Card with Standard Chartered Bank can apply. The service is available to individuals, companies, HUFs, partnership firms, and sole proprietorships.

faqs.question: Why should I use Online Banking?
faqs.answer: Online Banking is free, easy to apply for, and simple to use. It provides instant access to your banking, credit card, and loan accounts anytime.

faqs.question: What benefits does Online Banking offer?
faqs.answer: Online Banking gives real-time access to account information, personalized services, and complete control over your banking needs from one platform.

faqs.question: Is Online Banking safe and secure?
faqs.answer: Yes. Online Banking uses a unique Login ID and Password with end-to-end 128-bit SSL encryption to protect your account and transaction data.

faqs.question: How fast is Online Banking?
faqs.answer: Online Banking provides instant access to account information and enables transactions to be completed within seconds.

faqs.question: Is Online Banking convenient to use?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can securely perform banking transactions from the comfort of your home or office using the internet.

faqs.question: Is Online Banking available 24x7?
faqs.answer: Yes. Online Banking is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, including bank holidays.

faqs.question: Can I access Online Banking from overseas?
faqs.answer: Yes. Online Banking can be accessed worldwide except from Cuba, North Korea, Iran, Sudan, and Syria.

faqs.question: Do I need special software to use Online Banking?
faqs.answer: No special software is required. A PC with basic internet browsing capability is sufficient.

faqs.question: What fund transfer services are available through Online Banking?
faqs.answer: You can transfer funds between your own accounts, other Standard Chartered accounts across India, and accounts at other banks using NEFT and RTGS.

faqs.question: What is RTGS and when can it be used?
faqs.answer: RTGS (Real Time Gross Settlement) allows instant transfer of INR 2,00,000 or more to RTGS-enabled banks.

faqs.question: How can I register for Online Banking instantly?
faqs.answer: You can register instantly using your ATM, Debit Card, or Credit Card by validating your details with an OTP sent to your registered mobile number.

faqs.question: How can I apply for Online Banking through a form?
faqs.answer: Fill out the registration form available at branches or via Phone Banking and submit it. Your Login ID and Password will be sent to your registered mailing address within 3 working days.

faqs.question: Is there any charge for Online Banking?
faqs.answer: No. Online Banking is completely free of charge.

faqs.question: When do online credit card payments reflect?
faqs.answer: Credit card payments made online will reflect in your account on the next working day.

faqs.question: What security features protect Online Banking users?
faqs.answer: Security features include login authentication, encrypted data transmission, automatic session timeout, last login display, and prevention of multiple logins.

faqs.question: What is encryption and why is it used?
faqs.answer: Encryption scrambles information during transmission to prevent unauthorized access. Online Banking uses strong encryption to protect all transmitted data.

faqs.question: What precautions should I take to protect my Online Banking password?
faqs.answer: Never share your password, avoid easy-to-guess passwords, change it regularly, and ensure privacy while logging in.

faqs.question: What should I do if I suspect unauthorized transactions?
faqs.answer: Immediately report the issue to Standard Chartered Phone Banking to terminate access and prevent misuse.

faqs.question: What are eStatements?
faqs.answer: eStatements are electronic versions of bank and credit card statements that can be viewed and printed online in PDF format.

faqs.question: Are eStatements free of charge?
faqs.answer: Yes. eStatements are provided free of cost.

faqs.question: How are eStatements delivered and secured?
faqs.answer: eStatements are delivered monthly via email as password-protected PDF files.

faqs.question: What is SMS Banking?
faqs.answer: SMS Banking allows customers to check account and credit card information using predefined SMS keywords.

faqs.question: Is SMS Banking charged?
faqs.answer: SMS Banking is free, but standard SMS charges by your mobile operator may apply.

faqs.question: What are Banking Alerts?
faqs.answer: Banking Alerts are SMS notifications that inform you about transactions and activities on your bank or credit card accounts.

faqs.question: Are Banking Alerts chargeable?
faqs.answer: Yes. Banking Alerts are chargeable as per the bankâ€™s schedule of charges.

faqs.question: How many accounts can be linked to Banking Alerts?
faqs.answer: All your savings, current, and credit card accounts can be linked to the Banking Alerts service.
